**Literature and Culture Course Description**

An introductory course to provide students with the understanding of world literature and culture with respect to classic and modern critical considerations; basic concepts such as the definition of literature and culture, literary genres and themes, the reading of literary and non-literary texts, cross-disciplinary approaches in the studies of literature and culture will be presented.

In-depth discussions will be conducted on issues that are of historical significance or critical to contemporary situations concerning culture or topics that are important to the efforts of global environments and cultures.

**Overview of Course Goals**

1.  To assist students in understanding basic literary and cultural concepts, terms and to provide opportunities to students to read, discuss and further explore areas of newly acquired interest.
2.  To introduce students to a literature and cultural readings, using a thematic focus.
3.  To provide students with learning situations and activities that further utilize and refine their proficiency in the 4 skill areas in reading, writing, speaking and listening.
4.  To give students learning opportunities to become independent learners, using English, inside and outside of the classroom environment.
5.  To allow students opportunities to plan and monitor their individual learning progress, with the instructor’s guidance.

**Attendance**

In order to learn, participation is an important key for your success. Therefore, it is important to attend class. If you have a conflict, NOTIFY me or the Department of English, well BEFORE the class begins. Arrangements for any missed classes must be made with the instructor within three days of the missed class. Exceptions can always be made in the case of emergencies.
